etymology.description: Line on 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") indicates cutting edge -> disappearance of knowledge -> perish
etymology.interpretation: The character 亡(wáng) visually represents the sharp, cutting edge of a knife, which metaphorically implies the loss of life or things 'perishing'. Over time, it came to signify broader concepts of disappearance and extinction.

examples.english: The country is broken, the family perishes.

examples.chinese: 经过激战时(經過激戰時)，士兵亡(士兵亡)。
examples.english: During the intense battle, the soldiers perished.
